required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Angulated Screw-retained Crowns Following Immediate Implant Placement
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of Cemented and Angulated Screw-retained Crowns Following Immediate Implant Placement: a Randomized Controlled Clinical Trials

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University

brief_summary.textblock: There are two choices of restorations and implant abutments connection now: cemented and screw-retained.The excess cement, which would be difficult to completely remove, might lead to series of biological complications. The angulated screw channel (ASC) abutments, which recently introduced by Nobel Biocare , largely address the problem with visible screw access that may compromise esthetics. However, all of the present studies were clinical reports, thus the clinical efficacy of ASC abutments still needs the verification of evidence-based medicine with larger sample. Therefore, we designed a randomized controlled clinical trial study, aiming to verify the clinical efficacy of the ASC abutments by comparing screw-retained (with ASC abutments) single implant crowns with cemented ones in esthetic region.

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of bleeding on probing positive

arm_group.description: Restorations are connected to the implants by angulated screw channel system
Restorations are cemented onto the implant abutment

intervention.description: Implants are placed in fresh socket
To insert the restorations by angulated screw systems
To cement the restorations onto the implant abutment

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University
